Description: Fragment of lower wall of small black-figured pottery open vessel; glazed inside; outside: band at foot join, frieze of slim rays above; an animal to left (two legs and part of body with added red remaining) hastily drawn and seemingly with incised detail, is preserved from the main frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Unpublished. The degenerate style points more to Attic production than East Greek. There is much scratching on the surface; some seems to be part of black-figure decoration, and perhaps some to be a deliberate inscription.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2004)
